question_stem: The curves C₁ and C₂ have equations \(y = x(x-3)\) and \(y = x^2(2-x)\) respectively.

parts.question_text: Show that the x-coordinates of the points of intersection of C₁ and C₂ are given by the solutions to the equation \(x(x^2 - 2x - 3) = 0\).
parts.solution_text:
To find the points of intersection, we set the equations equal to each other:
\(x(x-3) = x^2(2-x)\)
\(x^2 - 3x = 2x^2 - x^3\)
Rearranging to get a cubic equation equal to zero:
\(x^3 - 2x^2 - 3x = 0\)
Factorising out x:
\(x(x^2 - 2x - 3) = 0\)
